newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian sugar prices end up on lower supply.
newsitem.headline: Indian sugar prices end up on lower supply.

text.p: Indian ready delivery sugar prices rose on reduced supply but mill delivery prices were subdued, dealers said.
They said heavy rain disrupted transportation of sugar from mills to the market.
"Further, fresh consumer buying was poor today," said a dealer.
In ready delivery, sugar S-30 rose 20 rupees to 1,470/1,510 rupees per quintal while M-30 rose 5 rupees to 1,490/1,540 rupees per quintal.
Mill delivery prices fell on strong mill supply and poor deamnd, dealers said.
In mill delivery, sugar S-30 fell 5 rupees to 1,415/1,425 rupees per quintal and M-30 fell 5 rupees to 1,435/1,455 rupees per quintal, they said.
Market sentiment was subdued at close of the session, dealers said.
